channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Covid in Wales: Calls to respect beauty spots as rules eased
item.description: Natural Resources Wales says, as sites get busier, people should respect the countryside.

item.title: Post Office scandal: Postmaster Tim Brentnall cleared
item.description: Tim Brentnall says it has taken 16 years to clear his name after being accused of stealing.

item.title: Paralympian 'told to wear more appropriate shorts'
item.description: Double world champion para-athlete Olivia Breen said she was left angry and speechless after being told to wear 'more appropriate' shorts.

item.title: Experts recommend Covid jabs for some under-18s in UK
item.description: The vaccines minister says he will announce the final decision in Parliament on Monday afternoon.

item.title: Barry Bagnall jailed for Wrexham hammer murder
item.description: Barry Bagnall hit Terence Edwards over the head twice during a "cold-blooded" murder, a court hears.

item.title: Guto Harri quits GB News over taking the knee row
item.description: The journalist was suspended for a gesture made during a chat about the abuse of black footballers.

item.title: Disabled access at Wales' tourist spots 'limit freedom'
item.description: Campaigners say the problem "destroys the experience and knocks people's confidence".

item.title: NHS: Tredegar building to tell story of Aneurin Bevan's inspiration
item.description: Tredegar Medical Aid Society was used as a blueprint by NHS founder Aneurin Bevan.

item.title: Defibrillator calls after Barry cricketer dies
item.description: Father-of-three Maqsood Anwar, 44, was playing cricket when he collapsed.

item.title: Football cap from 1905 returns to Wales from Australia
item.description: Walter Watkins' cap for his seventh appearance for Wales has been down under for decades.

item.title: Rescuers find lost dog Ollie after swim off Porthcawl
item.description: Ollie was found by the RNLI three miles away from where he jumped into the sea for a swim.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Self-isolation rethink over child contacts
item.description: Ministers consider whether children should not have to isolate if a close contact tests positive.

item.title: Covid: Pontypool shoppers want to 'revive' town centre
item.description: Once a major city centre, Pontypool town like many other places has seen shops close due to Covid.

item.title: Amputee's win for prosthetics funding in Wales shows 'people power'
item.description: David Bradley said amputees in Wales had been disadvantaged compared to the rest of the UK.

item.title: Covid: Why rinks opening in Wales is on ice
item.description: Although ice rinks can re-open from Saturday, Ice Arena Wales will be ready from 1 August.

item.title: Offa's Dyke: 'I needed to get off my backside and do something'
item.description: Jon Moss decided to sell his home and set off on a 177 mile trek across Wales.

item.title: Welsh woman reunited with family after Kuwait prison release
item.description: Sara Assayed returns home after being cleared of drug charges in Kuwait.

item.title: Wedding recreated at care home: 'This is the day I've been waiting for'
item.description: A new bride surprises her grandmother by recreating her wedding in her care home.

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Alun Wyn Jones fit for first Test, says Steve Tandy
item.description: Returning British and Irish Lions captain Alun Wyn Jones is fit for Saturday's first Test against South Africa, says defence coach Steve Tandy.

item.title: Football Association of Wales: Noel Mooney succeeds Jonathan Ford as chief executive
item.description: Former League of Ireland goalkeeper Noel Mooney is named the new chief executive of the Football Association of Wales.

item.title: Cazoo Open: Gareth Bale's support a 'boost' for Welsh golf, says Oliver Farr
item.description: Welsh golfer Oliver Farr says Gareth Bale's involvement in the Cazoo Open will be a "great boost" for the sport in Wales.

item.title: Jonathan Davies: Wales centre has no plans to 'fade away'
item.description: Centre Jonathan Davies plans to continue at the top level following the end of another Wales international season.

item.title: One-Day Cup: New Zealand's Hamish Rutherford set for Glamorgan stint
item.description: New Zealand batsman Hamish Rutherford is set for his Glamorgan debut as the One-Day Cup takes over from the county schedule.

item.title: Galw ar ymwelwyr i barchu ardaloedd poblogaidd Cymru
item.description: Cyfoeth Naturiol Cymru'n annog pobl i barchu cymunedau y maen nhw'n ymweld â nhw dros wyliau'r haf.

item.title: Sioe Frenhinol yn 'obeithiol' am £500,000 o gymhorthdal
item.description: Mae'r Sioe eisoes wedi derbyn £700,000, ond mae'r trefnwyr yn gobeithio cael rhagor i gefnogi'r digwyddiad.

item.title: Carcharu dyn am 18 mlynedd am lofruddiaeth yn Wrecsam
item.description: Bydd Barry Bagnall o Wrecsam yn treulio o leiaf 18 mlynedd yn y carchar am lofruddio dyn 60 oed y llynedd.

item.title: Lluniau o'r archif: Y Sioe Fawr dros y blynyddoedd
item.description: Gan fod Sioe Frenhinol 2021 wedi ei chanslo, beth am gipolwg ar rai o sioeau'r gorffennol?

item.title: Penodi Prif Weithredwr newydd Cymdeithas Bêl-droed Cymru
item.description: Noel Mooney i olynu Jonathan Ford fel Prif Weithredwr Cymdeithas Bêl-droed Cymru
